channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Russian luge athletes compete alongside Ukrainians in Lake Placid, N.Y.
item.description: Russian athletes trying to qualify for the Winter Olympics are in Lake Placid, sharing the luge track with counterparts from Ukraine. It's complicated, like Russians' path to compete in Milan.
item.content:encoded: Russian athletes trying to qualify for the Winter Olympics are in Lake Placid, sharing the luge track with counterparts from Ukraine. It's complicated, like Russians' path to compete in Milan.
item.dc:creator: Emily Russell

item.title: Without subsidies to make ACA affordable, millions could lose access to care in Texas
item.description: With Affordable Care Act plan premiums expected to increase in 2026, healthcare experts and advocates warn millions could be at risk in Texas, which already has the highest uninsured rate in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: With Affordable Care Act plan premiums expected to increase in 2026, healthcare experts and advocates warn millions could be at risk in Texas, which already has the highest uninsured rate in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Abigail Ruhman

item.title: TikTok signs a deal to spin off its U.S. operation
item.description: According to an internal company memo obtained by NPR, the Chinese-owned company has signed a deal to form a new joint venture to run the app in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: According to an internal company memo obtained by NPR, the Chinese-owned company has signed a deal to form a new  joint venture to run the app in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Detained migrant children aren't being reunited with family, government sources say
item.description: Employees in the government agency that deals with unaccompanied minors who crossed the U.S.-Mexico border say an order has been given not to release those children to their relatives here in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Employees in the government agency that deals with unaccompanied minors who crossed the U.S.-Mexico border say an order has been given not to release those children to their relatives here in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Mark Betancourt

item.title: Justice Department begins releasing Epstein files... What's next?
item.description: The Justice Department has begun releasing some the Epstein files. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Congressman Ro Khanna, D-Calif., who co-sponsored the legislation.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department has begun releasing some the Epstein files. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with Congressman Ro Khanna, D-Calif., who co-sponsored the legislation.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: From forestry to skiing, Maine relies on temporary foreign workers
item.description: Maine's business owners rely on H-2B visas for temporary foreign workers. But the 2026 cap on H-2B workers remains uncertain leaving some seasonal businesses unsure their staffing needs will be met.
item.content:encoded: Maine's business owners rely on H-2B visas for temporary foreign workers. But the 2026 cap on H-2B workers remains uncertain leaving some seasonal businesses unsure their staffing needs will be met.
item.dc:creator: Carol Bousquet

item.title: Central Casting has turned extras into stars for 100 years
item.description: For 100 years, Hollywood has relied on Central Casting. It's the real company behind movie extras — and where stars like Gary Cooper, Hattie McDaniel, and Brad Pitt got their start.
item.content:encoded: For 100 years, Hollywood has relied on Central Casting. It's the real company behind movie extras — and where stars like Gary Cooper, Hattie McDaniel, and Brad Pitt got their start.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: VA will cut 25,000 positions it has been unable to fill
item.description: The VA secretary says the department will trim at least 25,000 vacant positions from the rolls. That's after about that same number have already left the VA this year.
item.content:encoded: The VA secretary says the department will trim at least 25,000 vacant positions from the rolls. That's after about that same number have already left the VA this year.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Trump's year in Washington
item.description: President Trump won re-election in 2024 on a promise to upend Washington. He pitched a presidency where he alone could solve America's problems. Where does the current reality of these promises stand?
item.content:encoded: President Trump won re-election in 2024 on a promise to upend Washington. He pitched a presidency where he alone could solve America's problems. Where does the current reality of these promises stand?
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Parent volunteers help other parents through a pediatric cancer diagnosis
item.description: When a child receives a diagnosis of cancer, parents can feel overwhelmed. A new program helps connect them with volunteers who have cared for children who survived cancer.
item.content:encoded: When a child receives a diagnosis of cancer, parents can feel overwhelmed. A new program helps connect them with volunteers who have cared for children who survived cancer.
item.dc:creator: Jeanette Woods
